messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tanto on ebay
messages.msgSnippet: Note the reference to China?  This is not a real Japanese sword.  Never consider buying any supposed Japanese sword offered on Ebay from a dealer from China,
messages.messageBody:
Note the reference to China? This is not a real Japanese sword. Never consider buying any supposed Japanese sword offered on Ebay from a dealer from China, who is not Roger Robertshaw. And private sale auctions and anonymous dealers are sure signs of fake swords.
----- Original Message -----
From: jock1307
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, August 17, 2004 6:47 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Tanto on ebay


Hi,

since I am new to this forum ( and new to collecting japanese
swords ;-) ) first of all I´d like to send my greetings to you
from Germany (Trier) and thank everybody for many valuable infos
posted on this board.

I´ve seen a tanto on ebay

http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?
ViewItem&category=43338&item=2263805803

the koshirae look quite interresting to me and especially on the
picture showing the kissaki there is some hada and a faint hamon
visible though a possible yokote (i´m not sure if a yokote is
being placed on tantos) seems to be ground away due to improper
polishing.

Please excuse if what I presume is complete nonsense - it is as I
wrote - I´m a newbie...

bye and thanx

C. Alpermann

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tanto on ebay
messages.msgSnippet: HI there,  I agree with Doug, it is fake chinese crap.  The first give away is that it is being sold from china, the other give aways include the tang,
messages.messageBody:
HI there, I agree with Doug, it is fake chinese crap. The first give away is that it is being sold from china, the other give aways include the tang, signature, shape of the blade and kissaki, fake fittings etc.

Since you are new to collecting, I suggest going to Rich Stein, and Rich Turners web sites and looking under the "fake sword" sections, they are every informative and will save you alot of money.

Please buy from a reputable dealer or someone you know. If buying from ebay check feedback and stay away from any auctions out of china, 99.99 percent of them are junk and outright liars.

Good luck,

Louis

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tanto on ebay
messages.msgSnippet: Personally, I think it is a Chinese replica. A much better effort than most of the junk coming from China, but it just doesn t look right. The nakago is very
messages.messageBody:
Personally, I think it is a Chinese replica. A much better effort than most of the junk coming from China, but it just doesn't look right. The nakago is very poorly done, the habaki is off, the boshi is mishaped and I think it is brightly polished just to keep it a mystery. Plus it violates the primary rule for buying sword stuff from Ebay, which is NEVER buy anything from China.....
____________________________________________
Doug Blain, Manager, Information Technology Security
Computing & Communications Services,
University of Guelph
Phone: (519) 824-4120 ext. 56475
Fax: (519) 767-1620
